verses.text: 逾越節耶和華在埃及地告訴摩西和亞倫說：

words.note: Refers to the Jewish holiday commemorating the Exodus.
The personal name of God in the Old Testament.
Often used with place names to mean 'the land of'.

verses.text: 「你們要以本月為正月，為一年的第一個月。

words.note: Used with '為' (wéi) in the structure '以 A 為 B' (take A as B).
Used with '以' (yǐ) in the structure '以 A 為 B' (take A as B).
Historically, refers to the first month of the lunar calendar.

verses.text: 你們要告訴以色列全體會眾說：本月初十，他們各人要按著父家取羊羔，一家一隻。

words.note: Refers to the people/nation of Israel.
Refers to the tenth day of a month, often lunar calendar.

verses.text: 如果一家的人太少，吃不了一隻羊羔，家長就要和靠近他家的鄰居按著人數共取一隻。你們預備羊羔的時候，要按著各人的食量計算。

words.note: Indicates inability to complete the action of eating.
Forms '...的時候' (de shíhou) meaning 'when...' or 'at the time of...'
Part of the temporal phrase '...的時候'.

verses.text: 你們的羊羔要毫無殘疾，一歲以內的公羊；你們可以從綿羊或山羊裡取。

words.note: Often used with '從' (cóng) to mean 'from within'.

verses.text: 你們要把羊羔留到本月十四日，在黃昏的時候（「在黃昏的時候」直譯是「兩黃昏之間」），以色列全體會眾要把羊羔宰殺。
他們要取點血，塗在吃羊羔的房屋兩邊的門柱和門楣上。
當那一夜，你們要吃羊羔的肉，肉要用火烤了，和無酵餅與苦菜一同吃，

words.note: Refers to specific bitter herbs eaten at Passover.

verses.text: 不可吃生的，也不可用水煮；只可吃用火烤的。頭、腿和內臟都一起吃。
你們一點也不可留到早晨；如果有一點留到早晨，就要用火燒掉。
你們要這樣吃羊羔：腰間束上帶，腳上穿著鞋，手中拿著杖，快速地吃；這是耶和華的逾越節。

words.note: Combines 'rapid' (快速) with adverbial particle '地' (de).
Lit. 'pass over festival'.

verses.text: 因為在那一夜我要走遍埃及地，把埃及地所有頭生的，無論是人或是牲畜，都要殺掉；我也要審判埃及的一切神祇，我是耶和華。

words.note: Refers to the country/region of Egypt.
Indicates direct object is affected by verb.
Refers to the country/region of Egypt.
Refers to firstborn children or animals.
Refers to various gods and spirits, typically pagan.

verses.text: 這血要在你們居住的房屋上作你們的記號；我擊打埃及地的時候，一看見這血，就越過你們去，災禍必不臨到你們身上毀滅你們。

words.note: Often functions as a locative suffix.
Refers to the country/region of Egypt.
Used with '就' (jiù) to mean 'as soon as...then'.
Often paired with '一' (yī) for 'as soon as...then'.
Stronger than '會' (huì) for certainty.

verses.text: 這一日必作你們的記念日；你們要守這日為耶和華的節；你們要世世代代守這節日作永遠的定例。

words.note: Stronger than '會' (huì) for certainty.

verses.text: 無酵節「你們要吃無酵餅七天；可是第一天就要把酵從你們的家中除去；因為從第一日起直到第七日，凡吃有酵之物的，那人必從以色列中被除滅。

words.note: Lit. 'without leaven festival'.
Lit. 'without leaven cake'.
Indicates direct object is affected by verb.
Used with '從...起' for 'starting from...'
Literary, often found in legal or religious texts.
Classical Chinese construction for 'thing that has leaven'.
Stronger than '會' (huì) for certainty.
Often functions as a locative suffix, meaning 'in the midst of'.

verses.text: 第一日你們要有聖會，第七日你們也要有聖會；這兩日之內，除了預備各人所要吃的以外，一切工作都不可作。

words.note: Refers to a solemn religious gathering.
Refers to a solemn religious gathering.
Forms a nominal phrase referring to the object of the verb.

verses.text: 你們要守無酵節，因為就在這一天，我把你們的軍隊從埃及地領出來；所以你們要世世代代守這一日作為永遠的定例。

words.note: A major Jewish festival commemorating the Exodus from Egypt.
Used to pre-pose the object before the verb.
Refers to the large group of Israelites, often translated 'host'.
埃及 (Egypt) is a transliterated name.
A verb compound with directional complement.
An idiomatic expression meaning 'generation after generation'.
Refers to a permanent divine decree or law.

verses.text: 從正月十四日晚上起，直到本月二十一日晚上止，你們要吃無酵餅。

words.note: Historically, the first month of the lunisolar calendar.
Bread made without yeast, central to Passover and Feast of Unleavened Bread.

verses.text: 七日之內在你們的家中不可有酵；因為凡吃有酵之物的，無論是外國人或是本地人，那人必從以色列的會眾中被剪除。

words.note: Refers to fermented dough or yeast, forbidden during certain festivals.
Literally 'things that have leaven'.
Forms a noun phrase from the preceding clause ('those who eat...').
Refers to the collective body of people, especially in a religious context.
A biblical idiom for excommunication or divine punishment leading to removal from the community.

verses.text: 凡是有酵的，你們都不可吃；在你們一切居住的地方，你們都要吃無酵餅。」

words.note: Forms a noun phrase from the preceding adjective ('that which is leavened').
Bread made without yeast, central to Passover and Feast of Unleavened Bread.

verses.text: 逾越節的禮儀於是，摩西把以色列的眾長老召了來，對他們說：「你們要按著家族自己選取羊羔，把這逾越節的羊羔宰殺了。

words.note: Refers to the Jewish festival commemorating the Exodus.
Used to move the object before the verb for emphasis.
In biblical contexts, often refers to community leaders.
Used to move the object before the verb for emphasis.
Refers to the Jewish festival commemorating the Exodus.

verses.text: 要拿一把牛膝草，蘸在盆中的血裡，然後把盆裡的血塗在門楣上和兩邊的門柱上；你們誰也不可出自己的房門，直到早晨。

words.note: A plant used in ancient rituals for purification.
Used to move the object before the verb for emphasis.
Combined with '不可' means 'no one may'.

verses.text: 因為耶和華要走遍各處擊打埃及人；他一看見門楣和兩邊的門柱上有血，就越過那門，不讓那毀滅者進入你們的房屋來擊殺你們。

words.note: A transliteration of Yahweh, the personal name of God.
Āijí (埃及) is the name for Egypt.
Forms a '一...就...' structure, meaning 'as soon as... then...'
Forms a '一...就...' structure, meaning 'as soon as... then...'
Central to the meaning of 'Passover' (逾越節).
Indicates purpose, 'to come and...'

verses.text: 這教訓你們必須遵守，作為你和你的子孫永遠的定例。
日後，你們進了耶和華應許賜給你們的那地的時候，就必須守這敬拜之禮。

words.note: A transliteration of Yahweh, the personal name of God.
賜 (cì) is a more formal or divine 'give'.
Here part of '的時候' (de shíhou), meaning 'when'.
Part of '的時候' (de shíhou), meaning 'when'.
Literary equivalent of '的', often used in formal or biblical contexts.

verses.text: 日後，如果你們的子孫問你們：『你們這敬拜之禮有甚麼意思？』

words.note: A formal term for a worship ritual, often found in religious texts.

verses.text: 你們就要回答：『這是獻給耶和華逾越節的祭。耶和華擊殺埃及人的時候，越過了在埃及的以色列人的房屋，救了我們的家。』」於是人民低頭敬拜。

words.note: Verb-preposition compound, common in religious offerings.
Name of the Jewish festival.
Often used in biblical contexts for divine judgment.
Refers to the people of Egypt.
Specific term related to the Passover event.
Refers to the people of Israel.

verses.text: 以色列人就去行了；耶和華怎樣吩咐摩西和亞倫，以色列人就照樣行了。

words.note: Commonly used in biblical contexts for God's commands.

verses.text: 滅頭生之災到了半夜，耶和華把埃及地所有的長子，就是從坐王位的法老的長子，直到監牢裡遭囚禁的人的長子，以及所有頭生的牲畜，都擊殺了。

words.note: Refers to the tenth plague in Exodus.
Refers to the territory of Egypt.
遭 indicates undergoing an undesirable event.

verses.text: 在那一夜，法老本人和他所有的臣僕，以及全埃及的人都起來了；在埃及有極大的哀號，因為沒有一家不死人的。

words.note: Here 'that night', formed by 'that' + 'one night'.
Refers to royal officials and servants.
Describes intense sorrow and crying.
Verb phrase: to die a person, or to have a death in the family.

verses.text: 夜裡，法老把摩西和亞倫召了來，說：「你們和以色列人都起來，離開我的人民出去，照著你們所說的，去事奉耶和華吧；

words.note: Specifically refers to serving a deity or superior.

verses.text: 也照著你們所說的，連羊群牛群都帶著走吧，並且要為我祝福。」
埃及人催促以色列人，要他們趕快離開此地，因為他們說：「我們都要死了。」

words.note: A more formal or literary equivalent of 這裡 (zhèlǐ).

verses.text: 以色列人就拿了沒有發過酵的生麵，用衣服把摶麵盆綁好，扛在肩頭上。

words.note: Literally 'had not fermented'. Describes the state of dough.
Refers to dough that has not yet risen/fermented.
Specific term for a bowl used for kneading dough.

verses.text: 以色列人照著摩西的話行了，他們向埃及人索取銀器金器和衣服。

words.note: Often implies taking something by force or right.

verses.text: 耶和華使以色列人在埃及人眼前蒙恩，埃及人就給了他們所要求的。這樣，他們就奪去了埃及人的財物。
以色列人出埃及以色列人從蘭塞起行到疏割去，除了小孩子以外，步行的男人約有六十萬。
又有混雜多族的一群人和他們一同上去；他們還帶著羊群牛群和無數的牲畜同去。

words.note: Lit. 'a group of people'

verses.text: 他們把從埃及帶出來的生麵烘成了無酵的圓餅。這生麵原是沒有發過酵的，因為他們被驅逐離開埃及，所以不能停留，也沒有為自己預備食糧。
以色列人住在埃及的時間共有四百三十年之久。

words.note: Formal particle indicating duration.

verses.text: 就在四百三十年屆滿的那一天，耶和華的全軍都從埃及地出來了。

words.note: Lit. 'four hundred thirty years'

verses.text: 這是向耶和華守的一夜，因為耶和華把他們從埃及地領出來，所以這一夜是所有以色列人世世代代向耶和華守的一夜。

words.note: Marks the direct object before the verb
Reduplication emphasizes 'every' or 'from generation to generation'

verses.text: 逾越節條例耶和華對摩西和亞倫說：「逾越節的定例是這樣，凡是外族人都不可以吃羊羔的肉。
但是各人用銀子買回來的奴僕，如果你給他行了割禮，他就可以吃了。

words.definition: buy back, buy and bring back

verses.text: 寄居和受雇的都不可以吃。

words.note: Refers to a foreign resident, often with limited rights
Turns the preceding phrase into a noun 'the ones who are...'

verses.text: 必須在同一間房子裡吃，你不可把一點肉從房子裡帶到外面；羊羔的骨頭，一根也不可折斷。

breakdown.m: root, MW for long thin objects

verses.text: 以色列全體會眾都要守這逾越節。
如果有外族人寄居在你們中間，也願向耶和華守逾越節，他所有的男子都要受割禮，然後他才可以前來守逾越節；他就必像本地人一樣，但所有未受割禮的人都不可以吃這羊羔。

words.note: Lit. 'outside clan person'.

verses.text: 本地人和寄居在你們中間的外族人，都同屬一例。」

words.note: Lit. 'outside clan person'.

verses.text: 所有以色列人都奉行了；耶和華怎樣吩咐摩西和亞倫，他們就怎樣行了。

words.note: Commonly used in biblical context for divine commands.

verses.text: 就在這一天，耶和華按著他們的軍隊，把以色列人從埃及地領出來。

words.note: Indicates direct object is moved/acted upon.
V-C compound meaning 'to lead to come out'.
